availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky farmer. Virginia native. Married Anna Jane Curtis Goggin in 1830. Father of George C. Goggin, Robert C. Goggin, Susan E. Goggin, and Emily V. Goggin. Held eight slaves in 1860. Served in the House of Representatives of the Kentucky General Assembly from 1853 to 1855.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 3, p. 163. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 3, p. 183. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 2, p. 96. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 2, p. 17. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Washington, p. 1. Virginia, Marriages, 1785-1940, Ancestry, Lynchburg, 1830. Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, History of Kentucky, Volume II (Covington, KY: Collins and Company, 1878), p. 547-548.
